name: The West Bay Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Amazing! We had an amazing time from the moment we arrived at the resort. The front desk staff is very hospitable and makes sure to walk you to the room while explaining the resort as you go. We traveled with an 18 mo old and everyone was so friendly to us and really went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Our room was perfect for us (1 bedroom luxury) and the main bathroom even fit the crib so at night we still had full use of the bedroom, kitchen, living & powder room while the little one slept in bathroom (perfect sleeping conditions, really - no window!). Everything is really upscale and clean. The balcony is to die for - gorgeous views of the turquoise and teal water and comfortable seating for lounging or eating meals.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Friendly & Relaxing Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is the perfect size for the resort and is built with several wading areas which are perfect for little ones to stand or sit and splash in. The chairs by the pool are plush and cushioned and there is never a shortage of clean towels. The beach is gorgeous and well maintained. William and Renaud (I think) are out there from sunrise to sunset raking the beach, setting out chairs & umbrellas, sweeping the boardwalk, delivering water & watermelon, handing out snorkle gear, etc. etc. They really made every trip out to the beach relaxing and fun. If there aren't any free chairs they will set some out for you as well as lay out the towels and tuck them in nicely to the chairs so they don't blow away in the wind - they think of everything! Also, there was a basket of beach toys that our son loved to rummage through each day. And, before I forget to mention it, there is a little park with swings/slides down the beach to the left just past the neighboring resort.
reviews.title: The Best trip to T&C -Bravo West Bay Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was just fine for us and included what you would normally find at a continental breakfast plus sausage & eggs cooked to order. We ordered lunch once to be delivered to the room (only something they can do if not too busy) and dinner which we had to pick up from the bar. Both meals were good and I'd have to say dinner was pricey but worth it (the blackened shrimp appetizer was sooo good). We also walked to Somewhere on the Beach (a short walk at the Coral Gardens resort) and enjoyed happy hour/dinner there a few times.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views, Great Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I would come here again in an instant. The size of the resort is perfect. There are couples, empty nesters, families...pretty much everyone. It is quiet enough to be relaxing but not uppity so that if your kid is running around on the beach you think you are bothering someone. And did I mention that the entire staff is really really friendly? We took a walk down to Beaches (3 resorts down) and it was a zoo. Sure there is everything under the sun there to do, but the beach was not that deep and chairs were lined up in two long rows side to side to side. At WBC there is enough WIDE beach for everyone to have a lot of space...something that was necessary as our 18 mo old was playing & kicking in the sand and making quite a mess :)
reviews.title: Turquoise Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is wow. From the reception - rum punch and walk to our 1 bedroom Lux suite - 307- we were amazed. Dane- the manager and Rene at the front desk - could not have been better. Tabitha, Angela, Norman, William, Henri - just to name a few were also very helpful. Kalvin - our taxi driver for the week was so great.
reviews.title: Best spot on Grace Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a 2 weeks stay at WBC. What a beautiful property and excellent rooms/accomodation! We had a two bedroom luxury suite with fantastic morning beachfront views. We had a few glitches with the front desk staff (they seem unaware of the island's happenings) but management quickly addressed this and ensured the issue was resolved immediately. Kathy was the best person to ask for help. Otherwise, we made our own reservations/research. Breakfast was "continental" but sufficient. Antoinette ensured every guest was satisfied and went the extra mile to make everyone's day start off right. Her morning smile was contagious! Diner service was the other downfall but for a new resort, this is one of the "bumps" in the road. Limited items and they would benefit having a real chef and experienced/knowledgable staff. Room service and extended hours in the daytime would also be beneficial catering to families. There are plenty of amazing restaurants on the island including Coco Bistro (a must), The Vix (great new eurostyle), O'Soleil and our favorite, Grace's cottage. Evening bar was quite but relaxing. Henry (hard working and always ready to please) made THE best martini!
reviews.title: Best of Grace Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach is the best on Provo, hands down. Spacious chairs, outstanding beach services (Reno!!! thank you), water and watermelon served daily, nice white powder silica sand. This is our second stay in Provo and this location is by far much better than the busier "strip" of beach. Everything is within 10 minutes by taxi regardless where you are staying. Expect late diners (island caters diner after 6pm which can be tricky with small children, Coco bistro accomodated us at an ealier time) and most of the island has issues in the service industry as stated in previous reviews. This might be due to the minimum wage (almost criminal to pay this low) and long hours.. we tipped generously from teh beach staff to our room cleaner as they work very hard and results show on this pristine property.
reviews.title: Great property - excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, great location, great value and an enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Far and away the best value in Turks and Caicos...serenity and beauty all in one place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have to take exception to the reviews that have complained about a lack of service or management at West Bay Club. Our experience at the property from start to finish was excellent. Roxana, the Director of Operations, was fantastic. I requested a beverage not usually stocked at the property bar to be available for our stay - it was waiting for me when we arrived. I asked for roses to be delivered to the room on Valentine's day and they were there, perfectly arranged and setup in front of the window when we arrived to the room. Roxana and Dane, the General Manager, were visible around the resort every day and night, interacting with the staff and guests. They were excellent hosts for our stay at this terrific property. Our experience with their staff was also very positive - everyone was friendly and helpful to us.
reviews.title: Great Accomdations, Great Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom luxury unit (#407). The finishes and furnishings in the room are excellent. The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare a few meals for ourselves during the stay. The balcony is HUGE and we spent every morning and finished every night sitting on the comfortable chairs enjoying the view. The bed was very comfortable and the bedroom has excellent closet and dresser space. The master bathroom is large and well arranged.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our honeymoon at the WBC and while our overall experience there was good, the staff on the front desk were not what you would expect from a resort that markets itself as luxury. Granted, if you're staying in a studio, as we did, the WBC is proabably one of the better places to stay for $300 a night, but if you're staying in a 1 or 2 bedroom suite then I'm sure there are other places you'll want to consider on Grace Bay before WBC (Gansevoort next door, The Somerset, and Regent Palms in particular are highly recommended judging by what we saw and experienced in their restaurants and walking around the grounds).
reviews.title: Reasonably priced but front desk awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The studio room was larger than expected with a modern decor and very nicely appointed. We were told when booking that we'd been given the best studio and that it had an ocean view - don't be fooled, the view is a partial one and can only be seen from a side balcony that we never used (you will never use it too since it is not very private and the other balcony that faces the pool is bigger/better). You need to stay in a 1 or 2 bedroom suite to have a proper sea view. There's wifi, ipod docking, surround sound DVD player, a 42 inch TV, washer/dryer, and very small kitchenette (no cooker). Overall, the room was excellent and we couldn't really have any complaints for the money we were paying (except the lack of sea views mentioned above).
reviews.title: EXQUISITE BEAUTY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok - toast, bagels, croissants, muffins, choice of eggs, sausage, cereal, coffee and juice - and it came complimentary so can hardly complain. The restaurant (called the Atlantic Grill) was absolutely dead for lunch and dinner though...and we went in high season! We had the misfortune of eating there one night and can see why it was so dead - food was bland and tasteless. I am 100% sure the pasta we ordered came from a package and was not freshly made; for the price we paid I expected more. I can honestly say not to waste your time and money at the Atlantic Grill when there are so many other better places to eat on Provo. (Parallel 23, Grace's Cottage, O'Soleil are highly recommended for fine dining).
reviews.title: Wedding in Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the front desk staff...to say they were awful is an understatement! It is my understanding that many of the staff on front desk were new, but the fact that they lacked any professionalism and courtesy is a poor reflection on management. When we asked for advice on what activities to do, car rentals, prices etc they seemed very unknowledgeable. The dive shop I went diving with (Caicos Adventures, which I highly recommened by the way) recommended a day boat trip with a company called Outback Adventures, which had been doing the boat trip for the past 15 years. However, when I asked one of the girls on front desk if she could book the boat trip for us, in spite of her claiming to have 4 years experience in the tourist industry on provo, she'd never heard of Outback Adventures! Nor did she know how much car rental prices were! Or how much taxi's would cost from the hotel to the restaurants we wanted to go to! In fact, whenever we asked a question that you would expect a front desk person to know they hardly ever knew and furthermore nearly always gave off an attitude and seemed indifferent to providing any kind of service in helping you find the answer...as you would expect from a luxury resort. Many may say that this is just the Caribbean's relaxed approach to doing things, but we've been to many places in the Caribbean and never experienced anything quite like this.
reviews.title: Nice, but not all that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another word of warning about front desk - don't ask them to call a taxi for you! They have an arrangement with certain taxi drivers on provo who will charge you more for the ride than they should and give a kick-back to the front desk staff at WBC. We were told this by several taxi drivers (the WBC front desk staff are known for doing this) and, indeed, we experienced this first hand. Fortunately this was early in our vacation and we called for taxi's ourselves after that - recommended and reasonably priced taxi services are Mary's and Tommy's.
reviews.title: Best Time - Best People - Best Condo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am actually writing this review from the balcony of my room with the ocean right in front.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are currently in Turks and Caicos at the West Bay Club and enjoying every minute of it. ( internet is included)
reviews.title: Beautiful experience in Grace Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking a hotel in Provo I did lots of research and I think I am one of the pickiest people when it comes to hotel rooms. We were debating between Villa Renaissance and Seven Stars Resort and West Bay Club as all were priced in the same range. We ended up choosing West Bay Club as it seemed a smaller more intimate hotel and on a quieter part of the island.
reviews.title: Our Best Vacation Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a long flight( delays in Toronto) and were greeted with a friendly smile and a welcome punch. The front desk was amazing and very friendly. They showed us to our room and what a room it was. We booked a one bedroom luxury and it was pure luxury. The room is approx 1400 sq feet with a beautiful kitchen, 2 bathrooms and more room then we could imagine.
reviews.title: this place needs a MANAGER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove to the local grocery store which is only a few minutes a way and they had everything we needed to start our vacation and stayed in the first night as we wanted to enjoy the room.
reviews.title: Disappointed in the West Bay Club!!!

description: Recapture your sense of luxury at the latest elegant resort addition to the tranquil shores of Grace Bay, Turks & Caicos; creating new standards with its extraordinary location, chic architecture, superior finishes and luxuriously appointed suites. This graceful Turks & Caicos resort is private and intimate as it comprises only forty-six suites. Accommodations are sophisticated, yet relaxed. With large ocean front terraces, expansive glassed walls and dramatic living areas.
